direction.raw_text: Through the iron gates of an impressive-looking estate comes Debbie in her convertible VW Rabbit. dialogue.raw_text: Cole?

She makes her way past some sections of an undetermined animal's anatomy hanging from hooks suspended from the ceiling. Finally we see COLE WHITTIER, a Steve Garvey look-alike... rugged all-American, and heir to the Whittier Plastic Wrap fortune. Despite his jockish good looks and outward arrogance, there's something in his manner that is definitely unsavory. As Debbie approaches him we SEE that he is butchering some unfortunate friend of the forest on the table in front of him. (NOTE: For the squeamish, all of this is done OUT OF FRAME. The only thing we should HEAR are the delightful SOUNDS of TAXIDERMY.)

direction.raw_text: . STAN STAHL'S OFFICE - DAY DR. STAN is Rick's older brother and a proctologist. Although he's only in his early thirties, he thinks and acts like someone in their early 70's. A little on the pompous side, Stan is never without his pipe.

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, Rick, hold out your arm.

dialogue.raw_text: . THOMERSON I've seen another man's diddly.

direction.raw_text: Our people pile out of the hotel. Rick, Debbie and all Rick's friends run down the street. Suddenly a Porsche pulls up between Rick and Debbie. It's Cole. He reaches over and pulls Debbie into the car with him. She screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all board the bus.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cole, what the hell are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's mine!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's kidnapped her! Everyone into the bus!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Cole rounds a corner, a tire comes loose and rolls off the car -- thanks to Chulo's shoddy workmanship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, shit, shit, shit, shit. He looks to the rear and sees Rick's bus not far behind them. Suddenly he spots something O.S. He grabs Debbie and runs OUT OF FRAME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A city maintenance truck is driving slowly down the center of the street. A man in the back of the truck is leisurely placing orange cones in the center line of the road. Cole, with Debbie in tow, grabs the truck's DRIVER and hauls him out of his seat. He then places Debbie inside the truck and him at the wheel. He peels out. Our man with the cones in the back is unaware of what has happened. He keeps placing the cones on the street. However, now the truck is hitting speeds in the upper 70's. The man's leisure pace speeds up. He rapidly places cones on the road at break-neck speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick, is plowing into the cones and knocking them all over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our man with the cones is almost completely exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick is in pursuit, knocking over cones. He's almost caught up with Cole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vehicles reach the top of the hill. Cole grabs a sharp left and pulls into a movie theater parking lot. The maneuver loses Rick for a second. Rick jams on the brakes and doubles back into the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cole pulls up with a SCREECH in front of the theater. He grabs Debbie and jumps out of the truck. He drags her into the theater entrance. Rick brings his bus to a stop and he and the gang pour out of the bus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all go running into various theaters.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He and Debbie stand outside the theater, which is a multi-plex cinema. Fourteen movie theaters under one roof. Prominent is a sign which reads: "24 HOUR 3D FESTIVAL!" Cole drags Debbie into one of the theaters. The gang runs up to the theaters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fan out and look for them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He approaches a theater and sees the title of the movie playing inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick chooses a theater and goes inside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Aw, I've seen this one already.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The patrons are wearing their 3D glasses, watching the action on the screen. On the movie screen we SEE a man and a woman arguing. Cole and Debbie enter the theater. They run down to the front of the screen, heading for an exit. Rick enters. He gives chase and catches up with Cole. He takes a swing at Cole and Cole swings back. Behind them on the screen a man has come to the rescue of the woman. A fight starts in the movie, also. The patrons sit calmly watching the action. Miraculously, Rick's fight with Cole is in perfect sync with the actors in the movie. Rick hits Cole with a punch that sends him backwards into several movie patrons. The patrons are impressed by the realism of the film's special effects. Cole throws a punch. Rick ducks. The punch hits a MAN in the front row in the mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick climbs over several rows and continues to pummel Cole. Cole grabs a woman's purse and begins to hit Rick with it. Cole runs out of the aisle as Rick climbs over people and dives onto Cole, knocking him to the aisle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the movie ends, Rick has Cole by the collar and is dragging him out of the theater.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to LADY next to him) Gee, what a realistic effect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, like you're in the movie with them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to his date) Best 3D I've ever seen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rick exits the theater with Cole. He tosses Cole to Chulo. Debbie comes running behind Rick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Patrons are exiting. All of them are very up and excited by their 3D experience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A Man who has taken a punch and has had his jacket ripped to shreds doesn't seem pleased.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Debbie) Are you okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This has been quite a night. Here's a thought. Why don't we go home and give our private parts a workout?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hugging him) You're so romantic...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Absolutely amazing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've seen better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's another gorgeous day on the bluff overlooking the ocean. Just right for Rick and Debbie's wedding. We SEE the wedding in progress. The area is adorned with flowers. The many guests are seated and taken in the moment. Among these are Tracey, Desiree and Gary's she-man, who waves to Gary as he stands with the other ushers, Chulo, Ryko and Larry. Chulo is choked up and trying to hide his tears. He looks over at Laverne, who smiles to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nearby stand the maids of honor, Bobbie, Phoebie and Ilene, who blows a kiss to her date, Ray (one of the Japanese businessmen). The Thomersons sit in the front row. Neither of them is cherishing this moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They sort of smile at each other at the thought. Father Falwell is almost through with the ceremony. A car pulls up in the b.g. Exiting the car is Stan and a WOMAN. O'Neill, the best man, sees the car. He pokes Rick. He indicates to Rick someone has arrived.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Ryko) Hey, man, don't forget my bachelor party's next Friday night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll get the hookers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . THOMERSON (sotto; to Mrs. Thomerson) We'll have morons for grandkids. (resigned to the fact) But... at least we'll have grandkids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We SEE the man in the car is Stan. He ushers the lady in the car to Larry. He's surprised at who she is: his wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry looks to Rick and gives him a warm smile and a wave. Rick acknowledges Larry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sue!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, honey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How'd you get here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rick called me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't we go someplace and talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Now, before I pronounce you man and wife, the groom wishes to recite his vow to Debbie. Richard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They fear the worst.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . THOMERSON Oh, God Almighty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He turns to Debbie. He waits a beat and begins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now it starts to rain.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cheese. I love you more than cheese. And I love cheese a lot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They hide their faces in their hands. Off in the distance a storm is coming in fast over the ocean. The wind begins to pick up. Undaunted, Rick continues his soliloquy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In fact, more than dairy products in general. I love dairy. My love is cream. Pour me on the cereal of your life...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He wants this to end. He calls softly to Rick, trying to get his attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People begin to scurry for cover. In the b.g., under a tree, we SEE Larry and his wife huddled in each other's arms. From the way they look, they have worked things out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Rick. Rick. Hey...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I think this song pretty much sums up the way I feel at this moment. He begins to sing the theme from "The Flintstones" with all the gusto of Jack Jones. Father Falwell has had enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He blesses them lightning fast and springs for his car.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (rapid fire) I now pronounce you man and wife. Goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Rick continues to sing in the driving rain. Debbie joins in on the chorus. She loves her man. Everyone has run for the safety of their cars. Everyone but the Thomersons, who sit and look on bewildered.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: "Flintstones, meet the Flintstones They're a prehistoric family From the town of Bedrock They're a page right out of history..."
